title: Ham and Arugula Sandwiches with Cranberry Chutney
summary: Ham and Arugula Sandwiches with Cranberry Chutney is a dairy free recipe with 4 servings. This main course has 234 calories, 15g of protein, and 6g of fat per serving. For $1.93 per serving, this recipe covers 6% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has tried and liked this recipe. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 15 minutes. If you have ham, dijon mustard, cranberry chutney, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 30%. This score is not so awesome. Try Grilled Chicken Sandwiches with Arugulan and Chutney, Turkey Sliders with Brie, Arugulan and Cranberry Chutney on Sweet Potato Rolls, and Cranberry Turkey With Arugula Sandwiches for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 450.                                                                                                Place pizza crusts on a baking sheet. Bake for 5 minutes at 450 or until warm.                                                                                                Spread chutney over bottom side of 1 pizza crust. Spread mustard on bottom side of remaining crust. Arrange sliced ham over mustard-coated crust. Top with arugula. Place chutney-coated side of remaining crust over arugula. Cut into four equal sandwiches.

steps.step: Place pizza crusts on a baking sheet.
Bake for 5 minutes at 450 or until warm.
Spread chutney over bottom side of 1 pizza crust.
Spread mustard on bottom side of remaining crust. Arrange sliced ham over mustard-coated crust. Top with arugula.
Place chutney-coated side of remaining crust over arugula.
